column4: what tool should I use to be able to resume my download with firefox ?
wget -c
dawn`chorus: you mean in a terminal ?
Yes, run it in the same directory as the file ( "cd Desktop" before running the command ) and then do: wget -c URL
It should continue where it left off
dawn`chorus: I know that, my question was a general question, I mean how to be able to resume a download launched with firefox ?
What happens when you try to boot?
a grey screen, an apple at the center of the screen, and a small animation showing that it's trying to load something
Ahh, then it is trying to boot OSx and is failing
what should I do ?
Did OSx shutdown incorrectly ( if it did then by default it will bypass refit and boot OSx, you can configure refit to boot even after OSx is shut down incorrectly though )
And how did you re-install refit if the system won't boot?
I don't know, it's not my computer actually, I don't know what happend
I reinstalled it using the LiveCD
rEFIt or Ubuntu?
refit
No
At least if there is an fsck for HFS+ I wouldn't trust it
why?
what would you do then ?
Because write support is still sketchy and doesn't even support journaling
